notes.title: Vue.js
notes.body:
DAY 1
Project Structure:
- index.html, root where the browser going to read
- id="app", wrapper of the vue or considered as root
- src folder, brain of the vue application
- App.vue, root component

Reactivity:
- import { ref and reactive } // for reactivity


DAY 2
V-FOR:
- always put unique key when using v-for :key="post.id"

Single File Component:
- import PostItem from '@/components/PostItem.vue' 
- defineProps(), like @props() in blade
- <PostItem :post="post" /> , to pass the data from parent component to child
- <script setup> , for simplicity

Vue Router:
- in router/index.js directory import the view component from views folder
    import PostCreate from '@/views/PostCreate.vue'
- set up the route
    {
      path: '/posts/create',
      name: 'posts.create',
      component: PostCreate
    },
- in App.vue use <RouterLink to="/posts/create">Create Post</RouterLink> to create a link
- <RouterView /> , renders the component from views folder

V-MODEL:
- v-model , two way binding
- to make the variable reactive
    import { reactive } from 'vue'
    const post = reactive({
        title: '',
        body: ''
    })
- computed (returns something) in options api
    import { reactive, computed } from 'vue'
    const isFormInvalid = computed(() => {
        return post.title === '' || post.body === ''
    })
    <button :disabled="isFormInvalid" class="mt-1 btn btn-neutral">Add</button>


DAY 3
Emit events:
- emit , custom event listener
- from child to parent component communication
- defineEmits([]) , takes an array of custom emits or events

Pinia (State Management):
- stores folder
- separate the data and logic

Pinia Actions (Create):
- in stores/posts create an action 
- in PostCreate view , 
    import { usePostsStore } from '@/stores/posts'
    import { useRouter } from 'vue-router'

    const router = useRouter()
    const postStore = usePostsStore()

    const submit = () => {
        // usePostsStore().addPosts(post)
        postStore.addPosts(post)
        router.push({ name: 'home' })
    }

Pinia Getters:
- getters: same as computed

Using JSON-Server to save the state:
- npm install json-server
- create db.json in root directory
- move the post (array of objects) to db.json
- to run json server run this command , npx json-server db.json -w
- fetch the data
    getPost() {
      fetch('http://localhost:3000/posts')
        .then((res) => res.json())
        .then((data) => (this.posts = data))
    },

notes.title: Infinityfree
notes.body:
Deployment:
- composer install --optimize-autoloader --no-dev

- php artisan key:generate

- npm run build

php artisan config:cache
php artisan cache:clear
php artisan view:clear

- go to infinityfree > create account > create now > choose subdomain > email consent(I approved) > create account > finish > control panel > approve

- filezilla > put the host, username and password of infinityfree to filezilla > quickconnect

- .env > change the DB_HOST, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD and APP_ENV from local to production

- infinityfree accounts tab > mysqldatabases > create database > add datbase name > copy database name > put in DB_DATABASE in .env

- go to filezilla > inside htdocs folder upload the folder of your project

- after the uploading is finished > inside htdocs create new file named .htaccess

- edit .htaccess and put
<IfModule mod_rewrite.c>
    RewriteEngine On
    RewriteRule ^(.*)$ /project-name/public/$1 [L]
</IfModule>

- control panel > alter php config > on

- export the project's database as sql > go to mysqldatabases in infinityfree > phpMyAdmin > import > choose the sql file > go > it must be successfully imported



Free SSL Certificates:
- go to Free SSL Certificates tab > New SSL Certificate > put the domain name (without http:// and /) > create order > Setup CNAME Records
- wait until its ready > request certificate > install ssl certificate automatically > the status should "ssl certificate is active"
- to force the laravel app to https go to laravel project > app > providers > AppServiceProvider.php > inside boot function add \URL::forceScheme('https'); > upload the AppServiceProvider.php in infinityfree using filezilla or simply add this \URL::forceScheme('https'); using filemanager in infinityfree

notes.title: Laravel Notes
notes.body:
Blade templates & Layouts | Laravel 10 Tutorial #7 1. @yield('content') - copy a specific code from another file 2. @extends('layout' //filename) - copy the reusable template code from another file 3. @section('content') //code of the content @endsection - put the code of the content in the position of @yield. 4. @include('filename') - copy a specific code from another file 5. .env > APP_NAME= //name of your app - change the appname 6. in the title tag put {{ config('app.name') }} to change the appname Connecting to database | Laravel 10 Tutorial : #8 - mysql -u root -p - create database twitter; > exit - .env file > DB_DATABASE=twitter > DB_PASSWORD=toor - php artisan migrate - mysql -u root -p - use twitter - show tables; Creating Models (Crud) | Laravel 10 Tutorial : #9 1. php artisan make:migration create_ideas_table. 2. create migration, ex. $table->string('content'); //note: in MIGRATION you DEFINE the data in your table. 3. php artisan migrate > mysql -u root -p > use twitter//dbname; > show tables; - to check if the table was created. 5. each table is going to have its own corresponding model. 6. php artisan make:model Idea. Note: make the model name singular. 7. Controller > DashboardController.php > inside the public function index create instance of model for example the Idea.php model and assign value to the data/column of your table > $idea = new Idea( [ 'content' => 'hello twitter', ] ); $idea->save(); note: in CONTROLLER you ASSIGN VALUE to the column of your table. 8. Go to User.php model > copy protected $fillable > paste to the model of the table you just created ex. Idea.php > put the assignable column of your table, ex. 'content', 'like'. Note: the purpose of this is to use the easier way of assigning data to the table in Controllers > DashboardController.php which is $idea = new Idea( [ 'content' => 'hello twitter', ] ); 9. To display them to the view and to access each data of the table use @foreach ($ideas as $idea) //blade.php code

{{ $idea->content }}

{{ $idea->likes }} {{ $idea->created_at }} @endforeach. Note: $ideas is the table, content, likes and created_at are the columns. 10. return view('dashboard',[ 'ideas' => Idea::orderBy('created_at', 'DESC')->get() ]); - display dashboard.blade.php view and all data in Idea model/table. Laravel Form submission | Laravel 10 Tutorial #10 1. create a form using blade.php 2. create post form element inside it 3. create a post route > put a name in it ex. ->name('idea.create'), the 'idea' is the model name or resource name while the 'create' is the action. 4. put the name of the route ex. {{ route('idea.create') }} inside the action of your form. 5. put @csrf directives inside the form element to bypass the security mechanism of php againts csrf attack. 6. create a new controller to handle the proccess or request of a new idea/'content'. 7. php artisan make:controller SingularnameController. 8. create function inside the class of controller ex. public function store(){ } 9. put the class name and method name of the controller in the route. 10. give text area tag a name > give the dashboard route a name ex. ->name('dashboard') > inside the function of the controller you just created which is IdeaController put $idea = Idea::create( [ 'content' => request()->get('idea', ''), ] ); return redirect()->route('dashboard');. note: $idea = Idea::create() - to create the model in 1 line. The 'idea' is the name of text area tag, return redirect()->route('dashboard'); //to redirect to dashboard page. Flash Messages | Laravel 10 Tutorial #11 1.
